H0.text: if a piece of music is perceived to have changed key then we say the piece has. Modulated

H1.text: if a piece of music is perceived to have changed key then we say the piece has. Shifted

H2.text: if a piece of music is perceived to have changed key then we say the piece has. Altered

H3.text: if a piece of music is perceived to have changed key then we say the piece has. transposed

A4.text: A piece of music which is primarily written in one key may transition, or modulate, to another.

A5.text: Music written in one key can be converted to another, or transposed, by raising or lowering each pitch by the same number of semitones.

A6.text: The shifting of a melody, harmonic progression, or entire musical piece to another key while maintaining the same tone structure.

A7.text: In music, transposition refers to the process or operation of moving a collection of notes (pitches or pitch classes) up or down in pitch by a constant interval.
